application

Class Gui

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • application.Gui
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent>

    public class Gui
extends javafx.application.Application
implements javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent>
    This class represents the graphical user interface, which is responsible for managing the functionality of the game including starting new games, loading and saving games, event handling and the management of various application windows.
    Author:
    Annisha Akosah 300399598

      • createLevelsScreen

        public javafx.scene.Scene createLevelsScreen(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Constructs the Levels screen which gives users the ability to select a given difficulty level when starting a new game.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the resulting levels scene

      • createGameScene

        public javafx.scene.Scene createGameScene(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Constructs the game screen by building each game GUI component one at a time. Saves all of the game components (panes) as fields so they can be easily be referenced when updating the game state.
        Parameters:
        stage - the primary stage constructed by the platform
        Returns:
        the resulting game scene

      • createWinLoseScene

        public javafx.scene.Scene createWinLoseScene(java.lang.String status)
        Constructs a screen displaying a win or lose message. Give the user the option to play a new game (returning to the start screen), or quit.
        Parameters:
        status - a string denoting whether the user won or lost the game
        Returns:
        the resulting win/lose scene

        Attempts to read in a valid XML file.
        Parameters:
        stage - the primary stage constructed by the platform
        Returns:
        true if a file was successfully loaded or false otherwise

      • setGame

        public javafx.scene.layout.GridPane setGame(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Constructs the Game pane. This is where the rendering of the actual game occurs so construct a new Renderer here.
        Parameters:
        stage - the primary stage constructed by the platform
        Returns:
        the resulting game pane

      • setOxygenBar

        public javafx.scene.layout.GridPane setOxygenBar()
        Constructs the OxygenBar pane. This is where the health bar of the player is displayed
        Returns:
        the resulting pane holding the health bar

      • oxygenCounter

        private javafx.concurrent.Task oxygenCounter(int oxygen)
        Updates the length of the health bar based on time. Each second represents a drop in the health bar.
        Parameters:
        oxygen - the players health
        Returns:
        a new task to keep track of time passing

      • setInventory

        public javafx.scene.layout.FlowPane setInventory()
        Constructs the Inventory pane. This is where the inventory of the player is displayed. The player can only hold one item at a time, so only one item is toggled on at any given moment. Users may click on the buttons to use the item if it is in the player's possession
        Returns:
        the resulting pane holding the inventory

      • setOptions

        public javafx.scene.layout.GridPane setOptions()
        Constructs the Options pane. This is where the two options of picking up/dropping items is made available to the user through the use of buttons.
        Returns:
        the resulting pane holding the pickup/drop buttons

      • setScreen

        private javafx.scene.layout.GridPane setScreen(java.lang.String str)
        Constructs the Screen pane. This is where textual feedback is given to the user following a given action.
        Returns:
        the resulting pane holding the screen
